column4: Hello.  I have a strange problem fixing ssh without a password.  It had been working but now always asks for a password.  I have regenerated and setup authorized_keys but the server will not accept keys from any client, it just asks for a password.  Anybody familiar with ssh keys?
it seems like the server is setup to just use password or something
yes I have tried setting it to use keys with sshd_config, and I can see in -vvv that it does ssh_key_exchange etc
or the sshd is setup to use keys with password that's how I have mine set up actually
ok yes the sshd_config was very confusing...
/etc/init.d/ssh restart ?  I also rebooted the machine
you sure it's not your key passphrase it's asking for?
I regenerated the keys and hit enter when prompted for hte passphrase.  could the sshd_config force to ask for password?
it might be asking for the passphrase what does it say when you try to ssh in does it ask for username then password or just ask for password?
then it's asking for your passphrase password probably
did you make a passphrase when you made those keys?
no I hit enter for a blank passphrase
line 9 and ten from pastebin:  009. Your identification has been saved in /home/rugrat/.ssh/id_dsa.    010. Your public key has been saved in /home/rugrat/.ssh/id_dsa.pub.
yes with nmap man nmap will give you the full details of it
void^:  how can I download the package to install it on a remote machine behind a firewall that can't get out to the repositories
